:"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"tokenCollateralAddress","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amountCollateral","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amountTTCToBurn","type":"uint256"}],"name":"redeemCollateralForTTC","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"author":"Tariq Lashley  The system is designed to be as minimal as possible, and have the tokens maintain a 1 token == $1 peg.  This stablecoin had the properties:         - Exogenous Collateral         - Dollar Pegged         - Algorithmically Stable  It is similar to DAI if DAI had no governance, no fees, and was only backed by WETH and WBTC.  Our TTC system should always be \"overcollateralized\". At no point, should the value of all collateral <= the $  backed value of all TTC. ","errors":{"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"kind":"dev","methods":{"depositCollateral(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amountCollateral":"The amount of collateral to deposit","tokenCollateralAddress":"The address of the token to deposit as collateral"}},"depositCollateralAndMintTTC(address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amountCollateral":"The amount of collateral to deposit","amountTTCToMint":"The amount of decentralized stablecoin to mint","tokenCollateralAddress":"The address of the token to deposit as collateral"}},"liquidate(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"collateral":"The ERC20 collateral address to liquidate from the user","debtToCover":"The amount of DSC you want to burn to improve the users health factor","user":"The user who has broken the health factor. Their _healthFactor should be below MIN_HEALTH_FACTOR"}},"mintTTC(uint256)":{"params":{"amountTTCToMint":"The amount of decentralized stablecoin to mint"}},"redeemCollateralForTTC(address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amountCollateral":"The amount of collateral to redeem","amountTTCToBurn":"The amount of TTC to burn This function burns TTC and redeems underlying collateral in one transaction","tokenCollateralAddress":"The collateral address to redeem"}}},"title":"TTCEngine","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"depositCollateral(address,uint256)":{"notice":"follows CEI"},"depositCollateralAndMintTTC(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"This function will deposit your collateral and mint TTC in one transaction"},"liquidate(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"You can partially liquidate a user.You will get a liquidation bonus for taking the users fundsThis function working assumes the protocol will be roughly 200% overcollateralized in order for this to workA known bug would be if the protocol were 100% or less collateralized, then we wouldn't be able to incentivize the liquidators. For example, if the price of the collateral plummeted before anyone could be  liquidated "},"mintTTC(uint256)":{"notice":"follows CEIthey must have more collateral value that the minimum threshold"}},"notice":"This contract is the core of the TTC System. params.tokenCollateralAddress: The address of the token to deposit as collateral

params.collateral: The ERC20 collateral address to liquidate from the user
params.debtToCover: The amount of DSC you want to burn to improve the users health factor
params.user: The user who has broken the health factor. Their _healthFactor should be below MIN_HEALTH_FACTOR

params.amountTTCToMint: The amount of decentralized stablecoin to mint

params.amountCollateral: The amount of collateral to redeem
params.amountTTCToBurn: The amount of TTC to burn This function burns TTC and redeems underlying collateral in one transaction

depositCollateralAndMintTTC(address,uint.notice: This function will deposit your collateral and mint TTC in one transaction

liquidate(address,address,uint256).notice: You can partially liquidate a user.You will get a liquidation bonus for taking the users fundsThis function working assumes the protocol will be roughly 200% overcollateralized in order for this to workA known bug would be if the protocol were 100% or less collateralized, then we wouldn't be able to incentivize the liquidators. For example, if the price of the collateral plummeted before anyone could be  liquidated

mintTTC(uint256).notice: follows CEIthey must have more collateral value that the minimum threshold
